content: Feasts of the Lord
And the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘The feasts of the , which you shall proclaim  holy convocations, these  My feasts.
The Sabbath
‘Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day  a Sabbath of solemn rest, a holy convocation. You shall do no work  it  the Sabbath of the  in all your dwellings.
The Passover and Unleavened Bread(C)
‘These  the feasts of the , holy convocations which you shall proclaim at their appointed times.
On the fourteenth  of the first month at twilight  the ’s Passover.
And on the fifteenth day of the same month  the Feast of Unleavened Bread to the ; seven days you must eat unleavened bread.
On the first day you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no customary work on it.
But you shall offer an offering made by fire to the  for seven days. The seventh day  a holy convocation; you shall do no customary work .’ ”
The Feast of Firstfruits
And the  spoke to Moses, saying,

“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you come into the land which I give to you, and reap its harvest, then you shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest to the priest.
He shall wave the sheaf before the , to be accepted on your behalf; on the day after the Sabbath the priest shall wave it.
And you shall offer on that day, when you wave the sheaf, a male lamb of the first year, without blemish, as a burnt offering to the .
Its grain offering  two-tenths  of fine flour mixed with oil, an offering made by fire to the , for a sweet aroma; and its drink offering  of wine, one-fourth of a hin.
You shall eat neither bread nor parched grain nor fresh grain until the same day that you have brought an offering to your God;  a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
The Feast of Weeks(J)
‘And you shall count for yourselves from the day after the Sabbath, from the day that you brought the sheaf of the wave offering: seven Sabbaths shall be completed.
Count fifty days to the day after the seventh Sabbath; then you shall offer a new grain offering to the .
You shall bring from your dwellings two wave  of two-tenths . They shall be of fine flour; they shall be baked with leaven.  the firstfruits to the .

And you shall offer with the bread seven lambs of the first year, without blemish, one young bull, and two rams. They shall be  a burnt offering to the , with their grain offering and their drink offerings, an offering made by fire for a sweet aroma to the .
Then you shall sacrifice one kid of the goats as a sin offering, and two male lambs of the first year as a sacrifice of a peace offering.
The priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits  a wave offering before the , with the two lambs. They shall be holy to the  for the priest.
And you shall proclaim on the same day  it is a holy convocation to you. You shall do no customary work .  a statute forever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.

‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field when you reap, nor shall you gather any gleaning from your harvest. You shall leave them for the poor and for the stranger: I  the  your God.’ ”
The Feast of Trumpets(R)
Then the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘In the seventh month, on the first  of the month, you shall have a sabbath-, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, a holy convocation.
You shall do no customary work  and you shall offer an offering made by fire to the .’ ”
The Day of Atonement(U)
And the  spoke to Moses, saying:
“Also the tenth  of this seventh month  the Day of Atonement. It shall be a holy convocation for you; you shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire to the .
And you shall do no work on that same day, for it  the Day of Atonement, to make atonement for you before the  your God.
For any person who is not afflicted  on that same day shall be cut off from his people.
And any person who does any work on that same day, that person I will destroy from among his people.
You shall do no manner of work;  a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
It  to you a sabbath of  rest, and you shall afflict your souls; on the ninth  of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall celebrate your sabbath.”
The Feast of Tabernacles(AA)
Then the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘The fifteenth day of this seventh month  the Feast of Tabernacles  seven days to the .
On the first day  a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work .

seven days you shall offer an offering made by fire to the . On the eighth day you shall have a holy convocation, and you shall offer an offering made by fire to the . It  a sacred assembly,  you shall do no customary work .

‘These  the feasts of the  which you shall proclaim  holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire to the , a burnt offering and a grain offering, a sacrifice and drink offerings, everything on its day—
besides the Sabbaths of the , besides your gifts, besides all your vows, and besides all your freewill offerings which you give to the .

‘Also on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the fruit of the land, you shall keep the feast of the   seven days; on the first day  a sabbath-, and on the eighth day a sabbath-.

And you shall take for yourselves on the first day the fruit of beautiful trees, branches of palm trees, the boughs of leafy trees, and willows of the brook; and you shall rejoice before the  your God for seven days.
You shall keep it as a feast to the  for seven days in the year.  a statute forever in your generations. You shall celebrate it in the seventh month.
You shall dwell in booths for seven days. All who are native Israelites shall dwell in booths,
that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel dwell in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I  the  your God.’ ”
So Moses declared to the children of Israel the feasts of the .
